meanings.definition: Not firmly or tightly fixed in place
meanings.sent1: The loose tooth wiggled when she touched it.
meanings.sent2: The shirt was loose on him, hanging off his shoulders.
meanings.sent3: The loose lid on the jar kept popping off unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her loose hair flowed behind her like a golden waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The loose floorboard creaked under their weight.

meanings.sent1: The loose pants kept slipping down his hips.
meanings.sent2: She tied the loose knot, knowing it would come undone easily.
meanings.sent3: The loose socks made her slide around the polished floor.
meanings.sent4: The loose grip on the rope caused it to slip from his hands.
meanings.sent5: The loose belt hung loosely around his waist.

meanings.sent1: The teacher gave loose guidelines for the project.
meanings.sent2: His loose interpretation of the rules often got him in trouble.
meanings.sent3: The loose schedule allowed for spontaneous adventures.
meanings.sent4: Her loose definition of 'clean' left much to be desired.
meanings.sent5: The loose definition of success varied from person to person.

meanings.sent1: The loose bird soared high in the open sky.
meanings.sent2: The horse ran loose in the wide, open field.
meanings.sent3: The loose cat explored the neighborhood freely.
meanings.sent4: The loose prisoner finally tasted freedom after years behind bars.
meanings.sent5: The loose kite danced in the wind, untethered and joyful.
